drupalNodeEvent.title: Has the EAST Risen Again? Lessons from History

field_speakers.processed: Yasheng Huang (Epoch Foundation Professor of International Management; Professor, Global Economics and Management, MIT Sloan School of Management)

field_organizers.processed: 21st Century China Center, UC San Diego School of Global Policy & Strategy

field_description.processed: Yasheng Huang, professor of international management at MIT, presents from his book project on four factors that have shaped Chinaâ€™s development: Education, Autocracy, Stability and Technology (EAST). He focuses on the historical patterns of technological development from the Spring and Autumn Era (770 BCE to 476 BCE) to the Qing dynasty (1645 CE to 1911 CE) and draw lessons for the technological development and for the applicability of the EAST formula today. This webinar will be moderated by UC San Diego professor Victor Shih.
